intro: Eriobotrya deflexa var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered loquat, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible, orange-colored fruits. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental and fruit-bearing plant in subtropical regions.
